ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.trading

Interface TradeState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TradeStateAccepted, TradeStateCancelled, TradeStateComposing, TradeStateDeclined, TradeStateOffered

    public interface TradeState
    class TradeState uses the State Pattern to manage the various states a Trade can be in.
    See Also:
    Wikipedia: State Pattern

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void accept(Trade trade)
      Accept a trade.
      void cancel(Trade trade)
      Cancel a trade.
      void decline(Trade trade)
      Decline a trade.
      java.lang.Boolean isClosed()
      Returns whether the TradeState is Closed.
      java.lang.Boolean isEditable()
      Returns whether the TradeState is Editable.
      java.lang.Boolean isOpen()
      Returns whether the TradeState is Open.
      void offer(Trade trade)
      Offer a trade.

    • Method Detail

      • isClosed

        java.lang.Boolean isClosed()
        Returns whether the TradeState is Closed. A Closed trade is one which has been accepted or declined. That is, a Closed trade can no longer be interacted with.
        Returns:
        True if the trade is Closed. Returns false otherwise.

      • isOpen

        java.lang.Boolean isOpen()
        Returns whether the TradeState is Open. An open trade is one which has been neither accepted nor declined. That is, an open trade can be interacted with in some way.
        Returns:
        True if the trade is Open. Returns false otherwise.

      • isEditable

        java.lang.Boolean isEditable()
        Returns whether the TradeState is Editable. An editable trade is one which has not yet been offered.
        Returns:
        True if the trade is Editable. Returns false otherwise.

      • offer

        void offer(Trade trade)
           throws IllegalTradeStateTransition
        Offer a trade. A trade can only be offered if it is currently being composed, that is, if the current TradeState is TradeStateComposing.
        Parameters:
        trade - Trade to be offered.
        Throws:
        IllegalTradeStateTransition - if the trade is in an illegal state and cannot be offered.

      • cancel

        void cancel(Trade trade)
            throws IllegalTradeStateTransition
        Cancel a trade. A trade can only be cancelled if it is currently being composed, that is, if the current TradeState is TradeStateComposing.
        Parameters:
        trade - Trade to be cancelled.
        Throws:
        IllegalTradeStateTransition - if the trade is in an illegal state and cannot be cancelled.

      • accept

        void accept(Trade trade)
            throws IllegalTradeStateTransition
        Accept a trade. A trade can only be accepted if it has been offered, that is, if the current TradeState is TradeStateOffered.
        Parameters:
        trade - Trade to be accepted.
        Throws:
        IllegalTradeStateTransition - if the trade is in an illegal state and cannot be accepted.

      • decline

        void decline(Trade trade)
             throws IllegalTradeStateTransition
        Decline a trade. A trade can only be declined if it has been offered, that is, if the current TradeState is TradeStateOffered.
        Parameters:
        trade - Trade to be declined.
        Throws:
        IllegalTradeStateTransition - if the trade is in an illegal state and cannot be declined.
